children.value: Rainlink: Compatible with Nodelink, Lavalink and more in one client.

Designed to modularize lavalink/nodelink server management classes. Rainlink provides a solution that is compatible with any future version of lavalink/nodelink within the same codebase. You don't need to change too much or even your source code to still be able to run lavalink v3.7 as well as v4.
Driver based (avaliable to run Nodelink v2 and port older lavalink version)

contents.title: Introductions
contents.description: The world of JavaScript (JS) is filled with numerous lavalink clients and wrappers. There are currently around 140 of these clients available, but a major drawback is that each one only works with a specific lavalink version. While Riffy existed in the past, I found it to be limited in terms of scalability and compatibility with other versions. This is what inspired me to create a lavalink client that can seamlessly integrate with both older and upcoming lavalink versions. I'm excited to introduce this project to everyone - rainlink, also known as rainlink.js!

children.value: The world of JavaScript (JS) is filled with numerous lavalink clients and wrappers. There are currently around 140 of these clients available, but a major drawback is that each one only works with a specific lavalink version. While Riffy existed in the past, I found it to be limited in terms of scalability and compatibility with other versions. This is what inspired me to create a lavalink client that can seamlessly integrate with both older and upcoming lavalink versions. I'm excited to introduce this project to everyone - rainlink, also known as rainlink.js!

rainlink (a.k.a rainlink.js) is a lavalink client designed to modularize the lavalink/nodelink server management layers to make it easier for your discord music bot to be compatible with most versions of lavalink as well as nodelink. Currently rainlink is supporting lavalink versions from 3.7 to 4.x as well as nodelink v2. Additionally, in the future, I may port more older versions of lavalink and nodelink

Lavalink is an audio playback server designed for Discord applications. It supports audio streaming from various sources, including popular platforms like YouTube and SoundCloud. Lavalink provides a robust infrastructure for efficient audio handling, ensuring a smooth and high-quality audio experience for end users.
For detailed information on configuring Lavalink and other important considerations, please refer to the official documentation available at
. There, you will find step-by-step guidance, practical examples, and information on the configuration requirements necessary to successfully integrate Lavalink into your development environment.

Nodelink is also an audio playback server designed for Discord applications but made in JS. It is an alternative to Lavalink as Lavalink takes up a lot of resources while still maintaining Lavalink's API.
For detailed information on configuring Nodelink and other important considerations, please refer to the official documentation available at

. There, you will find step-by-step guidance, practical examples, and information on the configuration requirements necessary to successfully integrate Lavalink into your development environment. The connection method is similar to lavalink
How to download the Rainlink package?
To install Rainlink in your project, you can use a package manager like npm, yarn, or pnpm. Simply execute the appropriate command in your terminal:
After successful installation, you'll be ready to start using all the powerful features offered by rainlink in your Discord project.

Currently, rainlink does not support Bun. After implementing RFC 6455 code using native packages to reduce its size, an important function, net.createConnection(), is not called by Bun. Make sure to consider this when planning your integration.
Where I can find rainlink API doc?
You can find rainlink API doc by using this link:

Where I can find rainlink API doc?

contents.title: How to use rainlink?
contents.description: Here, I will show you how to use rainlink in the simplest way possible.

children.value: Here, I will show you how to use rainlink in the simplest way possible.
Driver in Rainlink is a class contain all basic communication function with lavalink/nodelink like WS/REST hadling.
The main features of driver is making a way to translate all current WS/REST api response to lavalink v4 api response. This will make Rainlink can run able on lavalink v3 and portable.
Currently, driver developing is not documented and supported. If you want, you can try.
This is the list of all rainlink driver currently supported (codename is made up by me)
in lavalink below v3.4 not supported
At the core of Rainlink is the

class, which serves as the primary interface for interacting with its features. This class encapsulates essential functionalities, including driver, plugin, player and node management, ensuring a cohesive experience for developers. Example of how to init
// You don't have to add this properties if you're using lavalink v4.
// If you use a version other than lavalink, you can refer to the Understanding the Driver section above
One of the key aspects of Rainlink is its modular approach to player and node management. By dividing responsibilities into distinct classes, such as
, Rainlink enhances clarity and organization within your application.
Players represent entities responsible for audio playback within a specific context, such as a Discord server. The
class handles player-related operations, offering functions for retrieving existing players, creating new ones, and accessing player-specific functionalities.
To retrieve a player associated with a particular Discord server, you can use the
To retrieve a player associated with a particular Discord server, you can use the
Creating a new player involves specifying relevant parameters, such as the Discord guild ID, guild shard ID associated voice/text channels:
Nodes are essential components in Moonlink responsible for handling audio streams and distributing workload efficiently. The
class facilitates node management operations, offering functionalities for adding, retrieving, and removing nodes.
To add a new node, you can use the
method, specifying parameters such as host, password, and port:

props.code:
<Rainlink>.nodes.add({
  name: "example lavalink", // You can set whatever you want
  host: "example.com",
  port: 2333,
  auth: "securePassword",
  secure: false, // Set true if your lavalink have ssl
  // You don't have to add this properties if you're using lavalink v4.
  // About using lavalink v3.7.x, you can change to lavalink@3
  // About using nodelink v2, you can change to nodelink@2
  driver: "lavalink@4"
})

children.value: // You can set whatever you want
// Set true if your lavalink have ssl
// You don't have to add this properties if you're using lavalink v4.
// About using lavalink v3.7.x, you can change to lavalink@3
// About using nodelink v2, you can change to nodelink@2
You can retrieve a node using identifier:
You can remove a node using identifier:

Lavalink serves as a simplified audio playback server, functioning as both an API and a WebSocket server for manipulating audio streams. It interfaces with LavaPlayer, which manages audio sources and related functionalities. Additionally, it includes Koe, similar to
, facilitating connections with Discord for audio transmission.

contents.title: Regular plugin
contents.description: So you are interested in using Rainlink and want to create your own plugin to extend some of Rainlink's features, so this page can help you somewhat.

children.value: So you are interested in using Rainlink and want to create your own plugin to extend some of Rainlink's features, so this page can help you somewhat.
Basically, the plugin in Rainlink will work by overriding the
class by adding or overriding variables and functions in it. Hence why it is called a plugin.
function return the name of that plugin.
function return the type of that plugin using
enum. In this article, we will use
function to load all the modded function of that plugin.
function to unload all the modded function of that plugin.
You can check all the requirement on

import { RainlinkPlugin } from "./plugin";
export { RainlinkPlugin as DeezerPlugin }

contents.title: Source Resolver Plugin
contents.description: Want to use any suitable music platform but can't find the official plugin? You can make it yourself right here!

children.value: Want to use any suitable music platform but can't find the official plugin? You can make it yourself right here!
Basically, the way it works will be similar to a regular plugin, but it will have stricter conditions so that you can search on lavalink and still be able to fallback to the plugin.
function return the name of that plugin.
function return the type of that plugin using
enum. In this article, we will use
function to load all the modded function of that plugin.
function to unload all the modded function of that plugin.
function return the name of that source. (For search from Lavalink, if it now avaliable, you can fill anything you want)
function return the ID of that source. (For search from Lavalink, if it now avaliable, you can fill anything you want)
You can check all the requirement on

contents.title: Library
contents.description: Are you a developer of the discord api library? Wow, I'm your fan too :0. Or you simply want the library you are using to support rainlink? Well, you can refer to this article.

children.value: Are you a developer of the discord api library? Wow, I'm your fan too :0. Or you simply want the library you are using to support rainlink? Well, you can refer to this article.
The way the Library class works is quite similar to
. So you can absolutely copy from
// sendPacket is where your library send packets to Discord Gateway
// getId is a getter where the lib stores the client user (the one logged in as a bot) id
// Listen attaches the event listener to the library you are using
// Only attach to ready event once, refer to your library for its ready event
// Attach to the raw websocket event, this event must be 1:1 on spec with dapi (most libs implement this)

contents.title: Driver
contents.description: Currently, the driver API on Rainlink is quite complicated, so this section will temporarily be "under development". You can still develop your own, but there will be no documentation for you to refer to except in the Rainlink source code itself.

children.value: Currently, the driver API on Rainlink is quite complicated, so this section will temporarily be "under development". You can still develop your own, but there will be no documentation for you to refer to except in the Rainlink source code itself.
